intro: Echinopsis schoenii, commonly known as the Schöenii cactus, is a species native to southern Africa. It is a spineless columnar cactus that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant produces large, showy white or pale yellow flowers during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions as a decorative plant.
